column4: Hi all, anyone now to make 4 speaker surrounding  make work in ALSA without using pulse..
why not PA?
it is giving me lots of issues. So I thought of using ALSA. If anyone can help me to slove issue. I can go with pulse
wouldn't it be better to solve those issues? just asking
Ya it is fine.. I will tell you the issue..
so ALSA works fine?
do you know that PA is ALSA improved, right?
so you'll likely have more issues with ALSA than with PA
hmmm... why don't you search on the internet for the error message PA gives you?
i'm sure it's more or less common
no because i don't really know why does that happen
please use Google, i'm sure you'll find your answer
ill try to help you then but im totally clueless, what brand and model is your card?
have you tried to contact Creative about Linux and drivers?
and your specific issue
as far as i know, Creative offers high quality, open source drivers for Linux, except the X-fi series
Google "creative audio drivers linux"
yeah, maybe some particular wrote drivers for it, which didn't work perfectly
.... you're using 8.04?
that's end of life, you know, right?
the thing is that 8.04 is not supported anymoree..... so having issues is 100% normal
what are the issues in Lucid? (10.04)
